meanings.definition: A shrub of the genus Shepherdia, native to North America.
meanings.sent1: The buffaloberry bush grows wild in the forest.
meanings.sent2: People enjoy hiking and spotting the buffaloberry shrubs along the trail.
meanings.sent3: The buffaloberry plant decided to throw a party for all the other plants in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her love for nature was as vibrant as a blooming buffaloberry bush.
meanings.sent5: The red berries on the buffaloberry bush looked like tiny jewels in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The small, red or orange edible fruit of the buffaloberry shrub.
meanings.sent1: She picked a handful of buffaloberries to make a delicious jam.
meanings.sent2: The children happily snacked on the sweet buffaloberries during their picnic.
meanings.sent3: The buffaloberries rolled down the hill, causing a fruity avalanche.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as contagious as the sweetness of ripe buffaloberries.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked pie filled the kitchen, with buffaloberry jam as the secret ingredient.
